page.title: 04Historic Houses.
page.content: {Tourism.}The area has several beautiful houses and cottages dating from the 14th Century most of which simply loved and lived in family homes. The only house open to the public is Belchamp Hall, Belchamp Walter built in 1720 by the third John Raymond and still lived in by his direct descendants. The Raymonds came to live in Belchamp Walter in Norman times. The house is open by appointment only and seems to be usually visited by coachloads of American Tourist. Near the house are a set of old stables, converted during the 1939-45 war to a cow house and in 1984 converted to an Exhibition Room and Art Gallery.
